info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rensselaer County through 315 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Hoosick Falls, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grafton, Pittstown, Schaghticoke, Valley Falls, Raymertown, Millertown, Southwest Hoosick, Petersburg Junction, Quackenkill, Potter Hill, Babcock Lake, West Hoosick, Johnsonville, Lincolnville, East Buskirk, Tamarack, Factory Hollow, Boyntonville, East Grafton and Tomhannock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
